com.jjoe64.graphview.series

Interface Series<E extends DataPointInterface>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BarGraphSeries, BaseSeries, LineGraphSeries, PointsGraphSeries

    public interface Series<E extends DataPointInterface>
    Basis interface for series that can be plotted on the graph. You can implement this in order to create a completely custom series type. But it is recommended to extend BaseSeries or another implemented Series class to save time. Anyway this interface can make sense if you want to implement a custom data provider, because BaseSeries uses a internal Array to store the data.

    • Method Detail

      • clearReference

        void clearReference(GraphView graphView)
        clear reference to view and activity
        Parameters:
        graphView -

      • draw

        void draw(GraphView graphView,
          android.graphics.Canvas canvas,
          boolean isSecondScale)
        Plots the series to the viewport. You have to care about overdrawing. This method may be called 2 times: one for the default scale and one time for the second scale.
        Parameters:
        graphView - corresponding graphview
        canvas - canvas to draw on
        isSecondScale - true if the drawing is for the second scale

      • getColor

        int getColor()
        Returns:
        the color of the series. Used in the legend and should be used for the plotted points or lines.

      • getHighestValueX

        double getHighestValueX()
        Returns:
        the highest x-value of the data

      • getHighestValueY

        double getHighestValueY()
        Returns:
        the highest y-value of the data

      • getLowestValueX

        double getLowestValueX()
        Returns:
        the lowest x-value of the data

      • getLowestValueY

        double getLowestValueY()
        Returns:
        the lowest y-value of the data

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns:
        the title of the series. Used in the legend

      • getValues

        java.util.Iterator<E> getValues(double from,
                                double until)
        get the values for a specific range. It is important that the data comes in the sorted order (from lowest to highest x-value).
        Parameters:
        from - the minimal x-value
        until - the maximal x-value
        Returns:
        all datapoints between the from and until x-value including the from and until data points.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        whether there are data points

      • onGraphViewAttached

        void onGraphViewAttached(GraphView graphView)
        called when the series was added to a graph
        Parameters:
        graphView - graphview

      • onTap

        void onTap(float x,
           float y)
        called by the tap detector in order to trigger the on tap on datapoint event.
        Parameters:
        x - pixel
        y - pixel

      • setOnDataPointTapListener

        void setOnDataPointTapListener(OnDataPointTapListener l)
        set a listener for tap on a data point.
        Parameters:
        l - listener
